item.title: Cmder
item.description: Quick write up on setting up a new Windows computer with development tools that I use. # setup.ps1 # https://scoop.sh/ Set-ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Scope CurrentUser irm get.scoop.sh | iex scoop bucket add main scoop bucket add extras scoop install main/cmder-full # cmder https://github.com/cmderdev/cmder comes with git-for-windows scoop install extras/sublime-text # subl https://www.sublimetext.com/ scoop install extras/fork # fork https://git-fork.com/ scoop install extras/renderdoc # renderdocgui | renderdoccli https://renderdoc.org/ scoop install hugo # hugo https://gohugo.

item.title: The Visionary
item.description: It took nearly two years, but I had completed my Magnum Opus. This was what I was going to be remembered for. I typed the last few lines of code. The final touches. I put out my cigarette. I had left the window open to let in the distant sound of cars and people crossing the Brooklyn Bridge. Littering the apartment were crumpled-up diagrams and formulas along with unopened letters from my fans.

item.title: Some things I've learned about 3D math and common sources of confusion
item.description: Having worked with linear algebra and math in 3D spaces for years now, I think it could be valuable to share some things that I’ve learned and some common sources of confusion when it comes to working in 3D spaces. At the very least, I can provide some insight into working with 3D maths as a game or game engine developer.
